TopicTitle: Any really nice shots of rocket engines? (in high resolution preferably)

Articles.Content:
My dad gave me a little picture frame with a Merlin rocket engine test firing for my birthday, it was a nice nerdy little present that I actually really appreciate. But when I look at it up close, I realize it's actually quite a blurry picture. It's probably due to the limited resolution the picture was printed from (I believe this is the pic in question: https://anjungsainssmkss.files.wordpress.com/2011/09/merlin_1c_firing_21.jpg)

So I looked around online, trying to find better resolution pictures and I'm finding it VERY hard to find any. Very little is over 1024 x 768, and those that are are often blurry upscales (or out of focus raw pictures). Does anyone know of a place that has good, high quality pictures of rocket engines? Either sitting on display, test firing, or even nice renders. The bigger the resolution the better, because that should help alleviate the blurry pixelated look that PC printed pictures sometimes get.
If there's someone who has good pictures of it then it must be SpaceX. Just send them an e-mail. In the worst case they say no, in all other cases they send you hires images or links to them.

The thought that comes to mind is that it may be difficult to get pics past a certain resolution because it may run into industrial espionage territory if there is too much detail. Have you tried a Google image search?

(Sorry that may be a run-on sentence that keeps running on and on...)
Maybe you can convert the images to vector graphics?
